repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.unittitle: Sir Charles Lock Eastlake letter, London, to James Carrick Moore
did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: ALS. Eastlake thanks Moore for his gift to the National Gallery of a portrait of Edward Jenner.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the Rubenstein to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Sir Charles Lock Eastlake Letter, 1859, Feb. 7, London, to James Carrick Moore, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: Finding aid derived from MARC record using DukeMARC2EAD-HOMproject.xsl, December 2014

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: English painter and keeper of the National Gallery.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: ALS. Eastlake thanks Moore for his gift to the National Gallery of a portrait of Edward Jenner.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Forms part of the Trent Manuscripts Collection.
